dialogue_content.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: I'd love to hear about your experience immigrating alone. That must have been challenging.

dialogue_content.original_text: I was just 20 years old when I left my home country.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject

dialogue_content.original_text: I had a single suitcase and a dream to build a better life.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject

dialogue_content.original_text: I remember stepping off the plane and being overwhelmed by the hustle and bustle of the city.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: It sounds like that was a pivotal moment in your life. How did you manage to stay motivated during those early days?

dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
dialogue_content.original_text: Staying motivated was largely about remembering why I came in the first place. I had this vision of contributing something meaningful to the world. I would often remind myself of my parents' sacrifices and the opportunities they wished for me. That sense of responsibility pushed me forward.

dialogue_content.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: So when did things change for you? When did you start to feel more settled in your new environment?

dialogue_content.original_text: The turning point came when I landed a job as a translator.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject

dialogue_content.original_text: It wasn't long before I was noticed by a larger firm, and they offered me a position.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: That's an impressive journey. So when did things change, leading you to work on high stakes projects like at the UN?

dialogue_content.original_text: I was approached about an opportunity to translate for a United Nations meeting.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: That sounds like an incredible opportunity. What were some of the core challenges you faced during that UN meeting?

dialogue_content.original_text: Additionally, understanding the different accents and dialects of the delegates posed a challenge.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: It's clear you had a significant impact. How do you feel about your language skills now?

dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
dialogue_content.original_text: Ah, language has been both a friend and a challenge in my later years. I must admit, there are times now when I find myself struggling to recall certain words in my native tongue. It's a strange feeling, almost like losing a piece of your identity. But then, I remind myself of the vastness of experiences I've had. It's a natural part of aging, I suppose.

dialogue_content.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: That must evoke a range of emotions. How do you reconcile those feelings of loss with the pride in your accomplishments?

dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
dialogue_content.original_text: It's a delicate balance, really. On one hand, there's the nostalgia for the simplicity and purity of my first language. On the other hand, there's immense pride in knowing that I've helped people communicate and understand one another. Every time I bridged a gap or resolved a misunderstanding, it reaffirmed my purpose.

dialogue_content.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: Your journey with languages has been profound. Looking back, what do you think has been the most rewarding part of your work as a translator?

dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
dialogue_content.original_text: Reflecting on my career, the most rewarding aspect has been the ability to bring people together. Knowing that my translations have paved the way for understanding is deeply gratifying. Language is such a powerful connector, and to be a part of that process is a privilege.

dialogue_content.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue_content.text: Before we finish, Lin, could you share a final lesson or insight from your remarkable journey?

dialogue_content.original_text: My journey from a small village to international stages taught me that resilience and an open mind are key.
dialogue_content.speaker: Subject
